items.title: BBC News app
items.summary: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

items.title: Belgium to recognise Palestinian state at U.N. General Assembly
items.summary: "Palestine will be recognised by Belgium at the U.N. session! And firm sanctions are being imposed against the Israeli government," Foreign Minister Maxime Prevot wrote on X.

items.title: President Trump's policies spark protests in multiple U.S. cities on Labour Day
items.summary: Demonstrators waved signs and banners calling for an end to what they said is a fascist regime; demonstrations in Chicago and New York were organized by One Fair Wage to draw attention to the struggles labourers face in the U.S.

items.title: U.K. sets out support for Afghanistan earthquake victims
items.summary: Response to the crisis has been hampered by the shrinking of funding for Afghanistan, led by U.S. aid cuts

items.title: Morning Digest: ECI to accept Bihar SIR claims until last date of polls nominations; Trump says India offered to cut tariffs to zero, ‘but it’s getting late’, and more
items.summary: Here is a select list of stories to start the day

items.title: Farmers seek more compensation for crop damage by wild animals
items.summary: Labour minister and district-in-charge minister for Dharwad on Monday spent the entire day visiting affected villages in his constituency (Kalaghatagi) where crops have been damaged by wild animals and held ‘Jana Spandana’ grievances redressal meeting in Kalaghatagi town.

items.title: Amnesty says Syrian government forces, allies behind 46 Druze ‘executions’
items.summary: Amnesty said it documented the “deliberate shooting and killing” of 46 Druze in Sweida city or on its outskirts on July 15 and 16

items.title: Mahesh Goud says Kavitha admitted corruption in Kaleshwaram
items.summary: “Why are BRS leaders, who claim they have done no wrong, so afraid of a CBI probe? If they are innocent, they should face the investigation,” Mahesh Goud said

items.title: Hindustan Institute students win Infosys Global Hackathon
Tamil Nadu to train students for 2026 World Skills Competition in China
Stalin visits vintage car centre in Germany
Stalin condoles death of man from Tamil Nadu in Qatar road accident
DMK government lacks courage to conduct caste-wise survey: Anbumani Ramadoss
BJP seeks re-investigation into Soujanya rape-murder case
items.summary: Karnataka High Court said in 2024 that no purpose will be served even if reinvestigation is permitted into the case

items.title: 2020 riots: Delhi High Court to pass order on bail pleas of Sharjeel Imam, Umar Khalid, others
items.summary: Umar Khalid, Sharjeel Imam and several others have been booked under UAPA for allegedly being the “masterminds” of the February 2020 riots in Delhi

items.title: Nestle sacks CEO over ‘undisclosed romantic relationship’ in office
items.summary: “The departure of Laurent Freixe follows an investigation into an undisclosed romantic relationship with a direct subordinate which breached Nestle’s code of business conduct,” a statement from Nestle said

items.title: Trump says he’s awarding former New York Mayor Rudy Giuliani the Presidential Medal of Freedom
items.summary: Mr. Trump called Mr. Giuliani the “greatest Mayor in the history of New York City, and an equally great American Patriot”

items.title: Tripura Minister labels news media as an obstacle for Panchayat representatives
items.summary: The Minister urged the Panchayat representatives to dedicate some time for the organisational activities of the BJP alongside their regular work

items.title: Army contingent departs for India-U.S. joint military exercise ‘Yudh Abhyas 2025’ in Alaska
items.summary: The Indian contingent, comprising troops from a battalion of the Madras Regiment, will train alongside soldiers of the 1st Battalion, 5th Infantry Regiment “Bobcats”, part of the Arctic Wolves Brigade Combat Team of the U.S. Army’s 11th Airborne Division

items.title: Woman found dead in Kozhikode, friend in custody
Heavy rain lashes parts of Bhadradri Kothagudem district; 16 gates of Taliperu reservoir lifted
The need to recognise women drug users
items.summary: There is no gender-sensitive infrastructure for drug users in J&K

items.title: CM Revanth Reddy raps officials, orders faster restoration of rain-hit infrastructure
items.summary: CM unhappy over complacency of officials over utilisation of SDRF funds

items.title: Rajasthan Assembly’s Monsoon Session starts with uproarious scenes
items.summary: As soon as the House assembled, the Congress members started shouting slogans and displayed placards against vote theft allegations

items.title: J&K’s Kishtwar highly vulnerable to glacial lake bursts: report
items.summary: Key public infrastructure including roads, schools and government buildings were at risk, the report highlighted; the district has the highest number of glacial lakes in the Union Territory.

items.title: Vandharai vaazhavaikkum Chennai is not just a saying; it reflects city’s soul: Nina Reddy
Southern Railway’s move to hire retired loco pilots draws flak
items.summary: Loco pilots, while organising protests at various railway stations, said while on one hand the recruitment of loco pilots was progressing at a slow pace, on the other hand, they themselves were suffering from denial of leave, and stress due to excess of work and continuous night duties

items.title: Govt. launches ‘Adi Vaani’ to translate Adivasi languages
items.summary: The government said that while the app is currently equipped to translate four languages – Gondi, Bhili, Mundari and Santali

items.title: Over 3 lakh acres of land hit by flood in Haryana; Faridabad on edge after release of excess water in Yamuna
items.summary: Over 46,880 farmers in 1,003 villages have registered on the e-Kshatipurti portal for crop damage claims

items.title: Medical device industry experts hold conference
Probe on into alleged online fraud
items.summary: The alleged fraud occurred over two years, between March 2023 and August 2025

items.title: Taiwan Education Centre inaugurated at CIT
Kochi sees significant surge in NDPS cases, seizures
items.summary: Over 300 kg of ganja, nearly 3 kg of MDMA seized in eight months; drugs flow into city in large quantities

items.title: Congress fought Delhi poll to ensure BJP’s victory: Bharadwaj
NCB seizes 590 kg ganja in Tiruvallur
School in Kochi revises rules, to fine parents for late arrival of students
items.summary: According to the revised rules, a child will no longer be punished or miss classes for arriving late. Instead, the onus has been placed on parents, who may now face a fine for bringing their wards late to schoo

items.title: Delhi govt. issues flood warning
items.summary: Relief camps being set up with basic amenities, with Yamuna likely to breach ‘evacuation level’ on Tuesday; all depts. put on high alert, says CM; Capital likely to receive more rain over coming days; Gurugram admin. asks schools, offices to go online

items.title: Kalkaji murder case: five more arrested
School merger drive: U.P. govt. says more than 70,000 modern playschools made operational
Settle pension dues of retired employees: CITU
After bird flu deaths in zoo, Delhi Health Minister says samples to be collected from poultry markets
JNUTA holds protest against dismissal of probationary professor
Aquarium pods, parking and better gates to be added to Kolathur fish market
MCD drive to identify stray dog feeding zones faces hurdles amid disputes between RWAs, feeders
‘Millennium City’ ramps up civic response after outcry over crippling infrastructure
items.summary: A two-day rain-induced deluge in July sparked public fury in Gurugram, prompting the city’s municipal corporation to launch a drive targeting waterlogging, waste management, and other civic issues

items.title: Man falls off ride at school ground
Bengaluru City University to host Victor Hugo symposium and Literary Fest on September 3
Immigration bureau set to check fraud, deport foreigners
items.summary: The Rules to govern the Immigration and Foreigners Act, 2025, notified by the MHA on Monday (September 1, 2025), allow for recording biometric data of foreigners and mandate educational institutions to inform the BOI about foreign students. Clubs and resorts can be shut down if frequented by illegal

items.title: India Ratings and Research resolves Rating Watch on TNPDCL, following successful restructuring
'No 10 shake-up' and Labour's 'asylum crackdown'
items.summary: Sir Keir Starmer's shake-up of his No 10 team as Parliament returns from recess dominates Tuesday's papers.

items.title: ‘Non-functional DMK government’ could not appoint even a regular DGP, says Palaniswami
items.summary: He charges the DMK government with attempting to appoint someone close to the party as the HoPF and alleges that the appointment of G. Venkatraman as DGP in-charge has not been done based on eligibility

items.title: Despite vacancies in government medical college hospitals in T.N., forensic doctors work at primary health centres
items.summary: According to the doctors, over 70 posts of assistant professors and senior residents in forensic medicine remain vacant. Even after 20 in-service doctors joining after October, many posts will remain unfilled, they add

items.title: Another chance: On Bihar’s Special Intensive Revision exercise and the Supreme Court order
items.summary: Allowing objections beyond deadline may help wrongly excluded voters

items.title: Body seen in secret mortuary could solve 50-year mystery of vanished religious leader
items.summary: Compelling evidence to suggest Lebanese Shia leader Musa al-Sadr was killed in Libya is uncovered by BBC.

items.title: Congress MP Sasikanth Senthil withdraws hunger strike temporarily
items.summary: Congress top brass appealed to give up the hunger strike, Mr. Senthil says; he was protesting against the Centre over Samagra Shiksha Abhiyan funds for Tamil Nadu

items.title: Lavanyam 2025 Onam celebrations begin today
RPF rescues 18 homeless persons
items.summary: The rescued persons included three women, 12 men, one mentally ill and two differently-abled men.

items.title: Will the Democrats go "dark woke" to take on Trump?
items.summary: California's governor has been imitating the president online.

items.title: 'Parliament building inaccessible to me,' MP says
items.summary: Marie Tidball MP was born with a congenital disability and wants Parliament to be more accessible.

items.title: Youth held on charge of stealing ₹10 lakh from hotel
Labourer killed, another injured in mud collapse in Bengaluru’s Yelahanka
CM seeks support of parties in AP and TS for Justice Sudershan Reddy
Tom Odell on the lesson he learnt from Billie Eilish and Finneas
items.summary: Tom Odell talks touring with Billie Eilish and the "anguish" behind his new album, A Wonderful Life.

items.title: Vegetable prices remain stable as Onam shoppers heave a sigh of relief
Incessant rain and flood disrupt life in northern India
items.summary: Punjab Governor to visit flood-affected districts from tomorrow; entire Himachal State declared as disaster hit; heavy rainfall warning issued for Haryana; precautionary measures ramped up in Chandigarh

items.title: Will accept Bihar SIR claims until last date of nominations: Election Commission of India
items.summary: Earlier in the day in Supreme Court, the poll panel submitted it would accept revision forms even after the deadline, and these would be integrated into the final list

items.title: 'The moments I play tennis for' - Osaka beats Gauff at US Open
items.summary: Two-time US Open champion Naomi Osaka earns her most impressive win since returning to the tour by knocking out third seed Coco Gauff.

items.title: Justice secretary to get power to veto sentencing guidance
items.summary: Shabana Mahmood has introduced a requirement for any new rules to be approved by her.

items.title: Amit Shah takes stock of rain-inflicted damage in Jammu and Kashmir, promises help
items.summary: Home Minister calls for strengthening early warning systems to reduce the impact of natural calamities; teams from Ministry of Home Affairs and union territory administration should prioritise damage assessment and a meeting of relevant departments will be held soon, he says

items.title: DMK govt. trying to save Madurai Mayor in property tax scam, says Palaniswami
items.summary: The AIADMK general secretary says without the Mayor’s instruction, the irregularities in the Corporation could not have happened

items.title: Maratha quota protest: Maharashtra government to act against ‘anti-social elements’
items.summary: “We can’t say that law and order has collapsed. Within half an hour, police cleared the roads,” Chief Minister Devenra Fadnavis said.

items.title: Premier League summer spending surpasses record £3bn
items.summary: Premier League clubs splash out more than ever before in a transfer window after spending this summer surpassed £3bn.

items.title: New orchid recorded in Arunachal Pradesh
items.summary: The Gastrochilus pechei has underlined the floral link between the State and Myanmar, the researchers said

items.title: Uttarakhand reserves 10% jobs for retired Agniveers in uniformed posts
items.summary: The Cabinet had approved the proposal for reservation for Agniveers in State government jobs last month

items.title: China, Russia join Iran in rejecting European move to restore sanctions on Tehran
items.summary: China and Russia were signatories to Iran’s 2015 nuclear deal with world powers, along with the three European countries, known as the E3

items.title: Prime suspect in murder of 18-year-old arrested in Uttar Pradesh
items.summary: Ishita Mallick was shot in her home in front of her family on the afternoon of August 25. While the details of the motive and the nature of the crime are still pending interrogation, the police said that a relationship feud may have been one of the possible motives

items.title: North Korean leader takes train to China for military parade
items.summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin, who has cultivated a close relationship with Mr. Kim, will also be at the parade

items.title: Nagaland University to develop grammar for 18 Naga languages
items.summary: Naga tongues have been taught in schools for decades, but none have a dedicated written grammar for the teaching-learning process

items.title: EU says von der Leyen's plane GPS system was jammed, Russian interference suspected
items.summary: In a statement, Bulgaria’s government said the GPS signal was lost as von der Leyen’s plane approached the southern city of Plovdiv

items.title: From 'not possible' to record spenders - Liverpool's transfer window
items.summary: Jurgen Klopp once suggested it was impossible for Liverpool to match their richest rivals in the transfer market. But no-one has spent more in this transfer window then they have.

items.title: Supreme Court seeks response to transgender-inclusive sex education plea
items.summary: The petition seeks the formal integration of age-appropriate, transgender-inclusive comprehensive sexuality education (CSE) into school curricula nationwide

items.title: First Afghan families allowed into Germany from Pakistan
items.summary: The 10 families have been among more than 2,000 Afghans caught in limbo in Pakistan as Germany's conservative-led government this year froze a programme to offer them sanctuary

items.title: Strikes across Gaza kill at least 31 as international scholars accuse Israel of genocide
items.summary: Israel has launched strikes across the Gaza Strip

items.title: No alternative to Bangladesh polls, says Yunus
items.summary: The warning comes after protests in the South Asian nation, which left a key leader hospitalised, with parties vying for power ahead of the first elections since the uprising

items.title: Dissanayake visits Katchatheevu, pledges to safeguard Sri Lankan territory
items.summary: The apparent reference to Katchatheevu drew immediate attention in local Tamil media, in the wake of actor Vijay’s recent remarks at a political rally in Madurai that Katchatheevu must be retrieved

items.title: Country-made pistol, 18 live rounds seized from robbery case accused at Sulur in Coimbatore

items.summary: Tamil Nadu submitted that the Centre and State had concurrent responsibility to fund the education of poor and disadvantaged children under Section 7 of the RTE Act, 2009

items.title: Farmers urge authorities not to disturb farming, grazing activities
Can minority-run schools be exempted from RTE law, SC refers question to larger Bench
items.summary: A Constitution Bench, in 2014, held that the RTE law violated the minority character of these institutions and took the institutions entirely out of the ambit of the law. On Monday, Justice Datta observed that the 2014 judgment has ‘unknowingly jeopardised the very foundation of universal elementary

items.title: People’s mindset should change to ensure there is no discrimination in sharing public resources, says Madras High Court
Heavy downpours leave Vizag reservoirs brimming
CM angry over delays in permissions for construction of high rises and other buildings
items.summary: Mr. Revanth Reddy says few officials deliberately delaying permissions

items.title: Cancellation of land allotment to LuLu Group in Vizag sought
items.summary: Resolution adopted demanding construction of a ‘science museum’ on the land

items.title: Congress to hold ‘vote theft’ awareness conference in Tirunelveli on September 7
